title: Russian Oligarch Igor Sechin’s Yacht Is Seized in France as It Prepares to Depart
sub_head: Authorities say the 280-foot vessel appeared to be trying to leave French territorial waters
body:
PARIS—French authorities said they seized a yacht belonging to a company majority owned by Igor Sechin, the chief executive of Russian oil producer Rosneft who was among a group of individuals sanctioned by the European Union over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
The 280-foot yacht, the Amore Vero, was seized overnight at a shipyard in La Ciotat, on France’s Mediterranean coast. The yacht was undergoing repairs, but French authorities said it was making arrangements to sail urgently.
